overview: CHUVIHONI looks at the places where memories live – in this case, within Britain’s Romani Gypsy culture.  The departure point was a belief that in Gypsy culture, as in others, collective memory is retained through the interrelationship of four phenomena: past places, past persons; present spaces, present persons. The challenge was to create a sense of these ‘memory spaces’ in the form of a film: a multi-disciplinary, multi-creator approach was essential in order to do justice to the nature of collective memory.
title: Chuvihoni
